intro: Kaulinia dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf kaulinia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. Kaulinia dilatata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
